clue: by putting forward the hands of the clock you shall not advance the hour [victor hugo]
it will not go out of my mind that if we pass this post and lantern either we shall find strange adventures or else some great change in our fortunes [the lion the witch and the wardrobe]
the enemy is within the gates it is with our own luxury our own folly our own criminality that we have to contend [marcus tullius cicero]
you will find something more in woods than in books trees and stones will teach you that which you can never learn from masters [saint bernard]

description: you must find all the codes and enter their coordinates
you have successfully removed the virus
if you would like to play again scan a code

clue: Now is the winter of our discontent/ Made glorious summer by this sun of York. [Richard, Act I, scene i]
What light through yonder window breaks? [Romeo, Act II, scene ii].
All the world's a stage,/ And all the men and women merely players:/ They have their exits and their entrances;/ And one man in his time plays many parts. [Jaques, Act II, scene vii]
Golden lads and girls all must,/ As chimney-sweepers, come to dust. [Guiderius, Act IV, scene ii]
